titleStmt.title: Linköping Diocesan Library, Kl f 17
titleStmt.sponsor: Greek manuscripts in Sweden – a digitization and cataloguing project

publicationStmt.publisher: manuscripta.se: A Digital Catalogue of Medieval and Early Modern Manuscripts in Sweden

p.note: Watermarks: Front flyleaf watermarked with interlocking CC surmounted by crown; cf. H. Voorn, Danish and Norwegian Paper Mills and their Watermarks (Hilversum, 1959), type III. 1: 1647, Royal Cipher CC addorsed and crowned upon patriarchal cross – unknown Danish paper mill. Part of this symbol was subsumed in the more famous Orholm Fabrique watermarks, cf. Fiskaa, Letters no. 42.
The letters contained in this watermark, L D and in the countermark (?) Hb (with b within the H) on the back flyleaf are not found in any of the repertories.

supportDesc.foliation: Pagination in ink in the upper outer corner, just above the first line of text: 1–198

p.note: Shelfmark numbers and a label for Linköping Diocesan Library.
Blank endleaf, except for an owner’s signature on the recto.

binding.p: Parchment laced-case binding over pasteboard, sewn on four supports. Tail endband oversewn with green silk; head endband missing due to spine damage. Handwritten spine title and label. Warped.
binding.condition: In good condition except for the top of the spine, where there is rodent damage; a rectangle of modern paper has restored a portion of the top margin of , cut out (presumably in order to eliminate marks of ownership). The paper is stained in various places, e.g. at , and the outer margin of . , are markedly stained by water damage. The first few lines at are stained in light brown. Some modern paper reinforcements in the fold of the first few quires.

history.provenance: The codex has, according to its previous description in Linköping Diocesan Library, belonged to the following owners: Petrus Pantinus, Dean in Brussels; Andreas Schottus, Antwerp; Johannes Meursius; further Christina Queen of Sweden or Georg Georg Konrad von Törring Seefeld . It was brought to Sweden in .
history.acquisition: Its last owner, before the volume was incorporated into the Linköping Diocesan Library collection in , was Erik Benzelius the Younger.

msItem.title: Epistulae
Epistulae 1–37
msItem.explicit: πλεῖστά με εὐφράνας ἑταίρων ἐλύπησεν ἥκιστα.

note.p: The epistles in this part of the MS are numbered αʹ–λζʹ in the margin by the main scribe. The reference numbers, below, are from Richard Foerster’s edition.

collation.signatures: In the lower center margin of first recto: αʹ

handDesc.handNote: Michael Apostolis; cf. Vat. Urb. gr. 127.

p.note: There are marginal annotations in Greek and Latin by various hands and in various shades of brown or greyish-brown ink.

decoDesc.p: The scribe uses a dull reddish brown ink for his elaborate penflourished initials and numbers, as well as for enlarged dots used as dividers for the insertion of the addressee’s name.

p.note: These two watermarks are present throughout the second codicological unit; the pages given are just examples.

supportDesc.condition:
On
, part of the text has been crossed out and new pieces of paper been pasted over, probably to correct some scribal mistakes or duplications.

handDesc.handNote: The beta in this hand is small and self-contained (a cuore).
The beta in this hand has a curved tail bent upwards.
Antonios Damilas Single words by this hand are found also on and .

p.note: A recent hand has drawn crosses in ink besides the beginning of each letter, and some annotations of contents e.g. . The same or another hand has drawn pointing hands.

decoDesc.p: No rubrication. Initials missing or added secondarily.

history.origin: Written in the latter half of the 15th or early 16th c., possibly in Crete , considering the scribes who contributed.

revisionDesc.change: Changing status from draft to published
